definition: grain/granule/classifier for small round things (peas, bullets, peanuts, pills, grains etc)

sentences.english: ONE day Henny-penny was picking up corn inthe rick-yard when—whack!
sentences.chinese: 一天，母雞潘姬正在她的乾草垛院子裏撿玉米粒。

sentences.english: Add rice, stir until coated and grains start to burst.
sentences.chinese: 加入米飯，拌炒至米粒脫皮及開始焦黃。

sentences.english: They are like grains of rice.
Like the spike of rice, the fuller it is, the lower it bows.
sentences.chinese: 像稻穗一樣，米粒越飽滿，垂得越低。

sentences.english: But rice grains do not move.
Cornstarch is made from the endosperm of the corn kernel.
sentences.chinese: 玉米澱粉由玉米粒胚乳製成。

sentences.english: There are more kernels in a given ear of maize.
sentences.chinese: 一個玉米穗裏會有更多飽滿的玉米粒。

sentences.english: We must reserve some of corn to use as seed.
sentences.chinese: 我們必須貯存一些玉米粒作種子用。

sentences.english: Sweet corn cook with other ingredients and 5 bowls of water.
sentences.chinese: 玉米粒與其餘材料加5碗清水大火煲沸。

sentences.english: Add rice and cook until the rice turn translucent.
sentences.chinese: 加入淘好的米煸炒至米粒開始變透明。

definition: boiled balls of glutinous rice flour, eaten during the Lantern Festival
